717622f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 70th to 71st Streets. In the centre is the older wing of the Sherman Square Hotel. The buildings at the left wull later be demolished and a new twelve-story wing added to the hotel, so that it covers the entire block. The two-story building with the "Plumbing" sign is an old frame structure. at the extreme right 1s Christ Church (Protestant Eplscopal). In the foreground, men have just started to break ground in the construction of New York's first subway.
March 19, 1901.
William B. Parsons Collection.
